TopicTitle: The Moment Elon Musk Heard about KSP

Articles.Content:
He now plays it, too!

He now plays it, too!

Oh well. He was pretty focused on his career there for a while, but now...

One could argue that's a troll account not made by Elon Musk.

As a moderator on another gaming server forum, I can confirm impersonations by making another account are ridiculously frequent.

EDIT: I mean, don't get me wrong, there's a very real chance it is him, i'm just saying there's an equally real chance it's not.

wonder if thats real or fake.....

guess without any posts, or mentions of it, we will never know...

So's he in the forums then?

Maybe. My gut feeling says that if he does have an account, that the username is something that would not identify him or attract attention; most celebrities do not like the attention and don't want to be bothered outside of their professional careers.

One could argue that's a troll account not made by Elon Musk.

As a moderator on another gaming server forum, I can confirm impersonations by making another account are ridiculously frequent.

EDIT: I mean, don't get me wrong, there's a very real chance it is him, i'm just saying there's an equally real chance it's not.

I can confirm this; "Lady Gaga" is a common troll account on a load of sites and forums. The only time that I've personally seen where a directly named account was the actual celebrity was Ron White out on Reddit; the guy proved it was him by posting this: http://imgur.com/hI8hY

He now plays it, too!

-Duxwing

I see nothing in there that says anything about KSP.

I see nothing in there that says anything about KSP.

ctrl + F (Find word in most browsers, I entered in "Kerbal")

"Musk also answered questions, ranging from the mundane (he gets six hours of sleep a night) to what games he plays (the Kerbal Space Program)" <- bolded for emphasis mine

In "How to live like elon musk" (Is it just me, or is that phrased like some weird celeberty talk show?)

Edited January 22, 2015 by Norpo
bolded for emphasis

About a year ago I was at a lecture from astronaut Andre Kuipers, I got the chance te ask him a question. IT had something to do with Dragon / Space X (since Kuipers was on board the ISS when the first Dragon arrived). I kinda choked up when Kuipers complimented me on my question. After a long and very comprehensive answer the presenter of the talks that day offered me a chance to ask another question.

I was shocked by the fact that a astronaut complimented me and my brain refused to come up with a question, so I asked him about Kerbal Space program. To bad he was unaware of the game .

nah. Elon Musk is obviously Whackjob's secret identity ;P

...or maybe Danny's. That would be some hilarious irony xD

It seems like famous people rarely actually participate in communities of the game. Not as themselves anyway. Even in small scale, it's super-rare to see Scott Manley (illectro/szygy) post on Reddit or KSP Forums. Nassault's only very recently made his first post on the forum.

If I play Kerbal enough and get 6 hours of sleep at night, I can become Elon Musk?

Nassault's only very recently made his first post on the forum.

He's been posting since 2012.

I do hang out on IRC all the time, it's just hard to remain solidy engaged when I have a demanding day job too.

I do hang out on IRC all the time, it's just hard to remain solidy engaged when I have a demanding day job too.

You do a lot already with youtube Scott!
having family, job, hobbies, well it's kind of things that are usually priorities (usually in that order ) so no surprise to see our famous players a little bit too busy to haunt the forums.
